info.title: settings-api
info.description: API for managing user settings documents

get.summary: Get All Player Id Settings For Setting Type
get.description:
Get a list of all player settings for a specific Setting Type.

Required Permissions: `setting:read` for any player.  `setting:read:self` for the player of the access token.

**DEPRECATED** - Use v2 instead

parameters.description: Player to get settings for

schema.title: Player Id
schema.description: Player to get settings for

parameters.name: player_id

parameters.description: Setting Type to get settings for. Must be one of the known setting types

schema.title: Setting Type Id
schema.description: Setting Type to get settings for. Must be one of the known setting types

parameters.name: setting_type_id

parameters.description: Setting Key to get settings for. If not specified, all settings for the setting type will be returned

schema.title: Key
schema.description: Setting Key to get settings for. If not specified, all settings for the setting type will be returned

parameters.name: key

schema.title: Response Get All Player Id Settings For Setting Type

400.description:
Error Codes:
- `setting_type_not_supported` - The setting type is not supported at this time.  Contact an administrator

404.description:
Error Codes:
- `setting_type_id_not_found` - The setting type ID was not found

delete.summary: Delete All Player Id Settings For Setting Type
delete.description:
Delete all player setting for a specific type

Required Permissions: `setting:write` for any player.  `setting:write:self` for the player of the access token.

**DEPRECATED** - Use v2 instead

400.description:
Error Codes:
- `setting_type_not_supported` - The setting type is not supported at this time.  Contact an administrator

404.description:
Error Codes:
- `setting_type_id_not_found` - The setting type ID was not found
- `does_not_exist` - Setting Key(s) do not exist

get.summary: Get Single Player Uuid Setting Self
get.description:
Get a single player setting

Required Permissions: `setting:read` or `setting:read:self`

parameters.description: Setting Type to get settings for. Must be one of the known setting types

schema.title: Setting Type Id
schema.description: Setting Type to get settings for. Must be one of the known setting types

parameters.name: setting_type_id

parameters.description: Setting Key to get settings for

schema.title: Key
schema.description: Setting Key to get settings for

parameters.name: key

400.description:
Error Codes:
- `setting_type_not_supported` - The setting type is not supported at this time.  Contact an administrator

404.description:
Error Codes:
- `setting_type_id_not_found` - The setting type ID was not found
- `not_found` - The setting key was not found

put.summary: Set Single Player Uuid Setting Self
put.description:
Update the value of a single player setting.
    
Required Permissions: `setting:write` or `setting:write:self`

If Legacy types are enabled, to maintain compatibility with legacy applications, the following settings have special-case handling:
* Setting Type `case` - Version `1` - key `create` - creates a new case set and returns the new key and data in the response. 
* Setting Type `case` - Version `1` - key is integer - Modify an existing case set.  If it does not exist, a 404 response with the `does_not_exist` error code. 
* Setting Type `loadout` - Version `1` - key `create` - creates a new loadout and returns the new key and data in the response.  All items keys will be given a new key 
* Setting Type `loadout` - Version `1` - key is integer - Modify an existing loadout.  If it does not exist, a 404 response with the `does_not_exist` error code.  When modifying loadout items, item keys that convert into integers/longs are treated as updates (and will error the update if they are not valid), all others are treated as creates and will be given a new key.

parameters.description: Setting Type to update settings for. Must be one of the known setting types

schema.title: Setting Type Id
schema.description: Setting Type to update settings for. Must be one of the known setting types

parameters.name: setting_type_id

parameters.description: Setting Key to update setting for.  Must conform to the setting type key format

schema.title: Key
schema.description: Setting Key to update setting for.  Must conform to the setting type key format

parameters.name: key

schema.title: Response Set Single Player Uuid Setting Self

400.description:
Error Codes:
- `setting_type_not_supported` - The setting type is not supported at this time.  Contact an administrator
- `setting_version_invalid` - Setting Version is not valid for the provided type
- `update_not_enabled` - Setting Type Version has updates disabled
- `setting_key_invalid` - Setting Key does not meet requirements for that type/version
- `setting_value_invalid` - Setting value failed validation against the jsonschema defined for the type/version.  See response description for more details

404.description:
Error Codes:
- `setting_type_id_not_found` - The setting type ID was not found
- `does_not_exist` - Setting Key(s) do not exist - This will only occur for legacy setting types.

500.description:
Error Codes:
- `setting_type_version_schema_invalid` - Setting type/version jsonschema is invalid and could not be used to validate the setting value.  See response description for more details.

Update the value of a single player setting.

Required Permissions: `setting:write` for any player.  `setting:write:self` for the player of the access token.

If Legacy types are enabled, to maintain compatibility with legacy applications, the following settings have special-case handling:
* Setting Type `case` - Version `1` - key `create` - creates a new case set and returns the new key and data in the response. 
* Setting Type `case` - Version `1` - key is integer - Modify an existing case set.  If it does not exist, a 404 response with the `does_not_exist` error code.

When modifying loadout items, item keys that convert into integers/longs are treated as updates (and will error the update if they are not valid), all others are treated as creates and will be given a new key. 

**DEPRECATED** - Use the v2 endpoint instead.  This endpoint will be removed in a future release.

get.summary: Get Config For All Setting Types
get.description:
Get all setting types and their configuration.
    
Required Permissions: `setting-config:read`

schema.title: Response Get Config For All Setting Types

get.summary: Get Config For Single Setting Type All Versions
get.description:
Get a configuration and all versions for a given setting type ID.
    
Required Permissions: `setting-config:read`

schema.title: Response Get Config For Single Setting Type All Versions

404.description:
Error Codes:
- `setting_type_id_not_found` - The setting type ID was not found

get.summary: Get Config For Single Setting Type And Version
get.description: Get a specific version of a specific setting type.

404.description:
Error Codes:
- `setting_type_id_not_found` - The setting type ID was not found
- `setting_version_id_not_found` - The setting Version was not found for that type

v.title: V
v.description: Setting Type Version to update setting for.  Must be a valid version for the setting type

value.title: Value
value.description: New value for the setting.  Must conform to the jsonschema defined for the setting type+version

SetSinglePlayerSettingRequest.title: SetSinglePlayerSettingRequest
SetSinglePlayerSettingRequest.description: Updatable contents of a setting for a player

SettingData.title: SettingData
SettingData.description: Setting version/value data from a specific setting type/key for a player

versions.title: Versions
versions.description: Map of setting type version ids to the version

allow_update.title: Allow Update
allow_update.description: Are players allowed to set/update keys to this version of the setting type?  Does not affect getting or deleting existing settings.

key_regex.title: Key Regex
key_regex.description: Regex that is used to verify keys at assignment time

value_jsonschema.title: Value Jsonschema
value_jsonschema.description: [jsonschema](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/index.html) that is used to verify values at assignment time

tags.name: settings
tags.description:
Endpoints to get setting configuration and player settings

Player Settings are meant to be used as a document storage for players settings.

Settings are organized around Setting Types.  Each Setting Type can contain one or more Setting Versions.  Each Type+Version pair includes a jsonschema that is used to validate any update that apply to the setting.  This does NOT validate data for the get endpoints.  If the data is invalid, the get endpoint will return the data as it was stored.
